newsitem.title: KENYA: Sudan rebels say they capture town.
newsitem.headline: Sudan rebels say they capture town.

text.p: Sudanese rebels said they captured the southern town of Gogrial on Tuesday and now controlled most of the Bar el Ghazal region.

George Garang Sudan People's Liberation Army (SPLA) spokesman in Nairobi said: "Today (Tuesday) very early in the morning operation Deng Mhial captured Gogrial...we have now cleared the whole of Gogrial."

"It is very significant as it lies in Bahr el Ghazal region and the only major place which is left (in government hands) is Wau, which is the capital," Garang said after speaking to Sudan rebels by telephone.
There were no more details on the capture and no independent confirmation.
The SPLA has been active in the Bar el Ghazal region for years but regional capital Wau is a secondary target compared to the main southern city of Juba.
Gogrial is a small town 60 km (37 miles) north of regional capital Wau and around 100 km (60 miles) northwest of Tonj, a town the SPLA says it captured last Wednesday.

The SPLA is part of the National Democratic Alliance (NDA), a coalition between southern and northern opponents of the Islamist government in Khartoum. The rebels have seized a string of towns in the south and east since launching their current offensive in January.
